Basically, the game is well balanced except for the tank general. Although the tanks are cheaper and very strong here, the hackers, soldiers and planes are priceless. even if only a handful of hackers are lost, that is a huge loss compared to other chinese armies. The tank general also has no long-range weapons, such as infernos, atomic cannons or Thomahawks, so is actually always at a disadvantage, because on the one hand (as mentioned above) the aircraft are priceless and made of paper, the tanks are slow and he can actually counter nothing with the long-range weapons, therefore the tank general is easy prey for the enemy if he is only spamming long-range weapons.

Another concern would be that the community would break up, that some would have the patch and some would not, some (even) fewer games would be offered again if there were a unified patch (no MOD!) It would not be a problem for everyone. If there is a uniform patch, the game design (toolbar; command bar, where houses, units, etc. can be built - like Domi, Legis-Design) should not be changed.

Another (personal concern): In Germany there is only the censored version (change of voice, some dialogues so that sentences are left out, the soldiers don't suffer when they fall) They are obviously there, but not included, maybe you could reactivate them...?

The first thing that absolutely needs to be fixed is the performance. This is something that mod can't fix, some of the times games can lag a lot due to various reasons (mostly AI things). If the game could take advantage of the power of modern hardware, hope it can reduce the lag, and maybe open a ton of possibility for modding and mapping. This is one of thing require official input since it required to modify game code.

The third would involve some balance problem, might change gameplay, and upset some players. I felt like each general is not unique enough, for example, Laser General didn't have that many laser units, adding Laser Comanche would be the first step. Stealth is one thing that needs some changes, either reduce the stealth detection range or remove stealth detection from all defensive structures and units like USA Pathfinder can only detect stealth infantry...etc (Inspired by Contra, don't have to copy everything from it btw) Units like Sentry Drone, Listening Outpost, and Radar Van shall keep their detection capability as the original game. I rejected 1.06 because it has a lot of irreverent gameplay changes serving a paradigm that is irrelevant to what competitive ZH is meant to be about. 1.06 was sloppy work with a lot of extraneity to it and I consider it to be more of a full-on gameplay mod rather than the successor to 1.00 that 1.03/1.04 was and what 1.05a-e were hoping to become.

Any game that forces random vs random at the character selection layer is a complete joke competitively and this should have been rectified in some way over a decade ago in the case of ZH. "Army pick" as the format used to be called, should be the primary goal of every conservative balance effort the ZH community undertakes, with as many dynamics as possible left completely intact. Such alternative versions of the game must be made without compromising or complicating access to the original product, which is something the RA2/YR competitive community is bungling absurdly as we speak. Preserve the original game in its entirety and only then push a new standard to rival it. No one has the authority to fundamentally redesign a game to his own ideals.

I don't trust EA to conservatively improve any game, not after Tiberium Wars and certainly not after the Remastered Collection. I don't know anyone in the ZH community who has both the restraint and the wisdom to produce a proper series of minimalist updates to make the game competitive, nor did we have such people before the CBP was handed over to the folks that made 1.06.

If a new community balance patch were launched and it outright rejected the mistakes of 1.06 in favor of the restraint and deliberation such that 1.05 had, I would certainly give it my best shot and promote it if I liked it. ZH is my favorite game of all time, after all.

My opinion: keep the game original but...

- switch ingame layout to ControlBar pro (big shoutout to you Xezon!!!)

- fix army/building limit in multiplayer (currently 1600 i believe?)

- fix other serious error occurences

- Something I noted down once, can maybe be useful with regards to performance:
Disabling 3d shadows is only needed when playing AOD as it creates an issue when too many units are on the screen at the same time and shadows overlap. This shouldn't happen in normal games (not enough units crammed in 1 screen)

- fix the replay list bug:
when importing replays: the replay list is bugged with some text overlaying and empty slots
Cause: one of the replays takes place on a map that is not present on the PC
Solution: add the map to the PC...
Improvement: detect missing map and give notification instead of bugging out

- improve WAN connectivity, although I've been ***mostly playing just fine online on Revora throughout the years***, many new users are experiencing issues getting online on Revora.
I have also experienced some periods of varying success with regards to getting online.
When I have to resort to Gameranger, it feels like I'm entering the ugly underbelly of Zero Hour, haha!
What I mean is that I'm assuming there's probably currently better network connectivity available for users that are behind restrictive firewalls compared the technology used back when ZH was created?
(Would that be that a "C++ network library"? I'm guessing here, i'm in IT but I'm not a programmer, I don't know in what language ZH was created...)

- I'm sure you will have some other basically "functionallity" problems on your list! :)

But please, keep the *game play and balance* original, there are many multiplayer formats out there, many high level games, the game is growing massively, it's doing perfectly fine!!
Even keeping the army imbalances is important IMHO, not everything is on the super competitive scale.
Even if it is competitive, I have seen many great moments where the underdog wins in an army inbalanced game in a super competitive set!
Being able to control the clumsy china units is part of a *skillset*, even if they are frustrating, haha.
I love Zero Hour and it's definitely grown in the recent years, I'd hate to have a "balance patch" split the community and am basically happy that previous attempts to popularise such a patch haven't caught on.
